questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The book is ___ the table.'
Fill in the blank: 'The pen is ___ the box.'
Fill in the blank: 'She lives ___ Delhi.'
questions.explanation: 'In' is used with cities and countries.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He is standing ___ the door.'
Fill in the blank: 'The cat jumped ___ the wall.'
Fill in the blank: 'She walked ___ the bridge.'
questions.explanation: 'Across' indicates movement from one side to the other.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The ball rolled ___ the hill.'
questions.explanation: 'Down' indicates movement from higher to lower.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He climbed ___ the ladder.'
questions.explanation: 'Up' indicates movement from lower to higher.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The children ran ___ the garden.'
questions.explanation: 'Through' indicates passing from one side to another. 'Into' indicates entering.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The dog hid ___ the sofa.'
questions.explanation: 'Behind' indicates position at the back of something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The picture hangs ___ the fireplace.'
Fill in the blank: 'The shop is ___ the post office.'
Fill in the blank: 'She sat ___ her mother and father.'
questions.explanation: 'Between' is used for two people or things.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He distributed sweets ___ the children.'
questions.explanation: 'Among' is used for more than two people or things.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The train passed ___ the tunnel.'
questions.explanation: 'Through' indicates movement from one end to another.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'I wake up ___ 6 o'clock every morning.'
Fill in the blank: 'She was born ___ July.'
Fill in the blank: 'We have a meeting ___ Monday.'
questions.explanation: 'On' is used with days of the week.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The shop closes ___ noon.'
questions.explanation: 'At' is used with noon, midnight, and specific times.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'We go on vacation ___ summer.'
Fill in the blank: 'She has been studying ___ three hours.'
questions.explanation: 'For' is used with a period of time.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He has lived here ___ 2005.'
questions.explanation: 'Since' is used with a point in time.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Please finish this ___ Friday.'
Fill in the blank: 'We study ___ the evening.'
questions.explanation: 'In' is used with parts of the day.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She arrived ___ night.'
Fill in the blank: 'The concert starts ___ 8 p.m. ___ Saturday.'
Fill in the blank: 'He will return ___ a week.'
Fill in the blank: 'The store is closed ___ Sundays.'
Fill in the blank: 'I haven't seen her ___ last month.'
Fill in the blank: 'They waited ___ the rain stopped.'
questions.explanation: 'Until' or 'till' indicates up to a point in time.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She is afraid ___ the dark.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is good ___ cricket.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is interested ___ art.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is fond ___ music.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is proud ___ her achievements.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is angry ___ his friend.'
Fill in the blank: 'She apologized ___ being late.'
Fill in the blank: 'He insisted ___ paying the bill.'
Fill in the blank: 'She succeeded ___ passing the exam.'
Fill in the blank: 'He blamed me ___ the accident.'
Fill in the blank: 'She congratulated him ___ his success.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is married ___ a teacher.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is different ___ her sister.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is jealous ___ his brother.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is worried ___ her exam.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is capable ___ doing this work.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is qualified ___ this job.'
Fill in the blank: 'He depends ___ his parents.'
Fill in the blank: 'She believes ___ hard work.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is satisfied ___ the result.'
Correct the error: 'He has been absent since two days.'
questions.answer: He has been absent for two days.
questions.explanation: 'For' is used with a period of time, 'since' with a point in time.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'She is senior than me.'
Correct the error: 'He prevented me to go out.'
questions.answer: He prevented me from going out.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'She is suffering with fever.'
Correct the error: 'He agreed with my proposal.'
questions.explanation: 'Agree to' a proposal/suggestion. 'Agree with' a person.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'She is angry at her brother.'
questions.answer: She is angry with her brother.
questions.explanation: 'Angry with' a person. 'Angry at' a situation.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'He died from cancer.'
questions.explanation: 'Die of' a disease. 'Die from' an external cause like injury.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'She is good in English.'
questions.explanation: 'Good at' is used for skills and subjects.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'He lives on Mumbai.'
Correct the error: 'She arrived in the station.'
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific points like stations.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The thief escaped ___ the prison.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is looking ___ her lost keys.'
questions.explanation: 'Look for' means to search for something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He is looking ___ the children.'
questions.explanation: 'Look after' means to take care of.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She is looking ___ the window.'
questions.explanation: 'Look through' or 'look out of' the window.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He is looking ___ to the holidays.'
questions.explanation: 'Look forward to' means to anticipate with pleasure.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She was dressed ___ blue.'
questions.explanation: 'Dressed in' a color or type of clothing.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He is made ___ sterner stuff.'
Fill in the blank: 'The table is made ___ wood.'
Fill in the blank: 'Wine is made ___ grapes.'
Fill in the blank: 'The book was written ___ Tagore.'
Fill in the blank: 'He was killed ___ a sword.'
Fill in the blank: 'She went ___ foot.'
questions.explanation: 'On foot' is the correct phrase for walking.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He came ___ bus.'
questions.explanation: 'By' is used with means of transport.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She is ___ the phone.'
questions.explanation: 'On the phone' means using the telephone.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He is ___ holiday.'
Fill in the blank: 'She works ___ a bank.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is ___ duty today.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is ___ leave.'
questions.explanation: 'On leave' means taking time off work.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He agreed ___ me.'
Fill in the blank: 'She complained ___ the noise.'
Fill in the blank: 'He complained ___ the manager.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is addicted ___ coffee.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is allergic ___ dust.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is kind ___ animals.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is cruel ___ animals.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is similar ___ her mother.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is equal ___ the task.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is faithful ___ her husband.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is devoted ___ his family.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is grateful ___ your help.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is grateful ___ you.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is responsible ___ the project.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is accused ___ theft.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is convinced ___ his innocence.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is aware ___ the problem.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is full ___ energy.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is guilty ___ the crime.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is innocent ___ the charges.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is tired ___ working.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is sick ___ his excuses.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is short ___ money.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is sure ___ her decision.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is uncertain ___ the outcome.'
Fill in the blank: 'She is keen ___ learning new things.'
Fill in the blank: 'He is bent ___ succeeding.'
questions.explanation: 'Bent on' means determined to do something.
